thread.title: Accused baby death driver was drunk: court - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Accused baby death driver was drunk: court - Yahoo7

author: Aap
title: Accused baby death driver was drunk: court - Yahoo7
text:
Accused baby death driver was drunk: court Yahoo7 and AAP - Yahoo7 News on February 10, 2017, 2:23 pm Share Accused baby death driver was drunk: court - Yahoo7 A driver who drove through a stop sign and crashed into a family’s car on Phillip Island, killing a baby girl, was allegedly three times over the legal alcohol limit. Close Drunk driver ran stop sign and killed one-year-old girl, court hears UP NEXT VIDEO Drunk driver ran stop sign and killed one-year-old girl, court hears 
Blake Chadwick appeared before the Melbourne Magistates' Court on Friday charged with culpable driving causing death and other driving offences over the December crash. 
The 24-year-old’s Mercedes collided with a black Mazda on Smiths Beach Road, with police alleging Chadwick had a blood alcohol content of 0.156. The horror crash scene. Source: 7 News 
The 15-month-old child suffered critical injuries in the crash and was airlifted from the scene but died in hospital. 
The girl’s parents and her nine-year-old sister suffered minor injuries in the collision. 
Chadwick was arrested at the crash scene but was released the following day pending a further investigation. Blake Chadwick (black shirt). Source: 7 News 
He was formally charged last week and made a brief appearance in court on Friday. 
Chadwick was released on bail and ordered to surrender his passport and not drive a motor vehicle. 
He will return to court on May 3. The Phillip Island crash scene. Source: 7 News
